question.title: Pair with diff K
question.content:
You are given with an array of integers and an integer K. You have to find and print the count of all such pairs which have difference K.

Note: Take absolute difference between the elements of the array.

Input Format:
The first line of input contains an integer, that denotes the value of the size of the array. Let us denote it with the symbol n.
The following line contains n space separated integers, that denote the value of the elements of the array.
The following line contains an integer, that denotes the value of K.
Output format :
The first and only line of output contains count of all such pairs which have an absolute difference of K.
Constraints :
0 <= n <= 10^4
Time Limit: 1 sec
Sample Input 1 :
4 
5 1 2 4
3
Sample Output 1 :
2
Explanation
(5,2) and (1,4) are the possible combinations as their absolute difference is 3.
Sample Input 2 :
4
4 4 4 4 
0
Sample Output 2 :
6

rephrased.body: Given an array of integers and an integer K, determine the number of pairs in the array that have an absolute difference equal to K.
constraints: Take absolute difference between the elements of the array.

testcases.explanation: (5,2) and (1,4) are the possible combinations as their absolute difference is 3.
All pairs of 4's have an absolute difference of 0. There are 6 such pairs.
No pairs have difference 0 since all the elements are distinct
Only one number, so no pairs can be formed.
Pairs with difference 3 are (1,4), (5,2), (3,0) where 0 is not in the array. Actually the pairs are (1,4),(5,2) , (5,2)
The pair with a difference of 2 is (3,1).
